action.action-desc: Mr. Biggs introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to allow the pooling of tips among all employees, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Flexibility Act.
Section 3(m)(2) of the Fair Labor Standards Act (29 U.S.C. 203(m)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(ii), by striking employees who customarily and regularly receive tips and inserting pools of employees described in subparagraph (C); and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The pools of employees described in this subparagraph are as follows:

clause.text: Employees who customarily and regularly receive tips.

subclause.text: customarily and regularly receive tips and receive a cash wage paid by the employer that is not less than the wage in effect under section 6(a)(1); and
do not customarily and regularly receive tips.
